intro: Genipa maxonii, commonly known as the pink genipapo, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical, glossy leaves. Its fruits are typically red or pink when ripe and are used in traditional medicine and as a food source. The plant's ornamental value and medicinal properties make it of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
